div.bibl: Correspondence of Mr. P. S. Lambros, 130 N. Wells St., Chicago, Ill., Feb. 17, 1923. STATE OF ILLINOIS, LAW DEPARTMENT, CHICAGO

body.p: I have your very interesting discourse delivered before the Hamilton Club and shall read it with pleasure.

Lincoln and Pericles may have been the two greatest champions of democracy, but unfortunately, they are both dead. I maintain that Peter S. Lambros is one of the greatest modern champions of democracy and good citizenship.
